Episode number 4 of Series “Gas Welding”.

results.title: Gas welding equipment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Part one of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures through flame adjustments. Shows types of welds, cutting methods and closing down procedures. Close-up viewing of the equipment and materials being worked gives the learner an operator’s perspective into the art of oxyacetylene welding.

results.title: Public gardens and trees
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Host Audrey Hepburn explores the beautifully restored gardens at Mt. Vernon, originally created for the private pleasures of one of America’s first great gardeners, George Washington. This garden stands today as one of America’s most charming public gardens. Audrey Hepburn presents the diversity and wealth of public gardens in the city of Paris, among them, intimate ‘pocket-parks’, former grand royal gardens and spectacular pleasure gardens. Narrated by Michael York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions

results.title: Country gardens
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
The pleasure of a country garden - heavy with smell, taste and touch - has captured the imagination of artists and poets for centuries. Audrey Hepburn explores several of the world’s most beautiful country gardens, among them, the romantic Giardino del Ninfa, south of Rome; charming cottage gardens in England; the farmhouse gardens surrounding Chilcombe House in Dorset. Narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Flower gardens
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Perhaps no garden in the world exhibits a more exhilirating use of flowers than Claude Monet’s garden at Giverny. Monet’s exuberant palette of colours strikingly contrasts with the grace and elegance of the classic perennial borders found at Tintinhull House in Somerset, England. The native flora of America’s southeast further illustrate the range of aesthetics and pleasure found in the world’s most beautiful flower gardens. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions

results.title: Formal gardens
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Audrey Hepburn travels through the rich evolution of formal garden design in some of the world’s most spectacular settings - from the Renaissance gardens of Italy, (Villa Gamberaia, Villa Lante, Villa La Pietra), the grand 17th century gardens of France, (Chateau de Courances, Versailles), to the lushly planted gardens of England, (Hidcote Manor, Tintinhull House). Narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Tulips and spring bulbs
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
The vast, colourful bulb fields of our host audrey Hepburn’s native Holland are only a small part of a complex cultural phenomenon. Here bulbs are intertwined with the history and art of an entire country. The transformation from sleeping bulb to elegant bloom is miraculous. Narcissus, hyacinth, muscari and bluebells share the stage with the favourite, the tulip, for a grand tour of the spectacular Kreukenhof in Holland and Chenics Manor, in England and more. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions

results.title: Rose and rose gardens
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Host Audrey Hepburn, leads a glorious adventure with the rose, the world’s most popular flower. Starting with the French ideal of a rose garden at La Roseraie de l’Hays les Roses, to the magic of the unsurpassed collection of old roses at Montisfont Abbey in Hampshire, England, the rose claims its rightful place as the ultimate flower of legend, romance and beauty. Special guest appearance by world renown author and rosarian, Graham Stuart Thomas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)

results.title: Patch from scratch
results.creator_credit: Colin Grubb and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Witness Peter Cundall transform a patch of exhausted lawn into a productive vegetable garden yielding a cornucopia of fresh organic vegetables. Over an 18 month period the viewer follows the cycle of sowing, fertilising and harvesting through Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter. Peter demonstrates how to rotate the beds with legumes, brassicas, root crops and companion plants to maintain healthy crops and fertile soil, and how to keep pests and diseases at bay. Vegetables shown being grown include Peas, Beans, Lettuce, Endive, Tomatoes, Cabbage, Broccoli, Cauliflower, Garlic, Sweet Corn, Pumpkin, Cucumber, Zucchini, Swedes, Carrots, Onions, Capsicums, Potatoes, Oca and Artichokes.
